item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, November 1, 2024 at 11:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Linux on Apple Silicon with Alyssa Rosenzweig [audio] (136 points | 70 comments)
2. Apple acquires Pixelmator (751 points | 408 comments)
3. Sleep regularity is a stronger predictor of mortality risk than sleep duration (12 points | 2 comments)
4. Ask HN: Who is hiring? (November 2024) (246 points | 235 comments)
5. The almost lost art of rosin potatoes (23 points | 15 comments)
6. Alexander the Great's tunic identified in royal tomb at Vergina? (244 points | 121 comments)
7. Notepad++ is 21 years old (320 points | 150 comments)
8. Nvidia to join Dow Jones Industrial Average, replacing Intel (20 points | 3 comments)
9. RCE Vulnerability in QBittorrent (11 points | 1 comment)
10. Tell HN: We (Causal) got acquired – thank you HN (78 points | 32 comments)
11. Broadwell's EDRAM: VCache Before VCache Was Cool (50 points | 8 comments)
12. The Shell Hater's Handbook (2010) (53 points | 20 comments)
13. Ethernet at NANOG 92 (30 points | 5 comments)
14. Guide to applying to YC – from a founder who was accepted on the third try (47 points | 21 comments)
15. Low-cost, portable device can detect colorectal and prostate cancer in an hour (44 points | 10 comments)
16. Make It Yourself (214 points | 27 comments)
17. TokenFormer: Rethinking Transformer Scaling with Tokenized Model Parameters (112 points | 19 comments)
18. Show HN: Holos – Configure Helm and Kustomize Holistically with Cue (6 points | discuss)
19. Ask HN: Who wants to be hired? (November 2024) (46 points | 137 comments)
20. A Zine on Multiset Rewriting (3 points | discuss)
21. Using Large Language Models to Catch Vulnerabilities (66 points | 11 comments)
22. Show HN: I Built a Rock, Paper, Scissors roguelike in React (19 points | 12 comments)
23. Apple's M4 Max chip is the fastest single-core performer in consumer computing (192 points | 259 comments)
24. Math and puzzle fans find magic in Martin Gardner's legacy (59 points | 23 comments)
25. Ink: React for interactive CLI apps (121 points | 80 comments)
26. Implementing a Tiny CPU Rasterizer (30 points | 7 comments)
27. The Dual Nature of Events in Event-Driven Architecture (61 points | 27 comments)
28. Microprocessor's Romance with Integers (11 points | 5 comments)
29. 34x34x34 Rubik's Cube (183 points | 79 comments)
30. Oasis: A Universe in a Transformer (190 points | 71 comments)
